intro: Descurainia titicacensis, commonly known as the Andean tansy, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
